overview.title: Direct Cremation Services in Sale & Manchester
overview.lead: Direct cremation, also known as unattended cremation, is a simple and affordable option that provides a dignified farewell without a formal funeral service.
overview.paragraph1: At Arthur Kershaw Funeral Services, we understand that not everyone wants or needs a traditional ceremony. Direct cremation allows families to say goodbye in their own way, perhaps holding a memorial service or celebration of life at a later date when they feel ready.
overview.paragraph2: This increasingly popular choice offers simplicity and affordability while maintaining the dignity and respect your loved one deserves. Our professional team handles all arrangements with the same care and attention we've provided to families since 1892.

why_choose.title: Why Choose Direct Cremation?
why_choose.subtitle: A Personal Choice
why_choose.intro: There are many reasons families choose direct cremation:

reasons.title: Simplicity
reasons.description: Some people prefer a simple farewell without the formality of a traditional service

reasons.title: Affordability
reasons.description: Direct cremation is the most economical option, helping families avoid financial burden

reasons.title: Flexibility
reasons.description: Hold a memorial service when and where you choose, without time pressure

reasons.title: Personal wishes
reasons.description: Many people specifically request no fuss or ceremony

reasons.title: Environmental considerations
reasons.description: Simpler process with reduced environmental impact

why_choose.conclusion: Whatever your reasons, we respect your choice and ensure your loved one is cared for with dignity throughout.

services.title: Professional Care
services.description: Collection of your loved one from anywhere in Greater Manchester, professional care in our chapel of rest, and all necessary paperwork and documentation.

services.title: Simple Coffin
services.description: A simple, dignified coffin suitable for cremation. Environmentally friendly options available if preferred.

services.title: Cremation Arrangements
services.description: Transportation to the crematorium, crematorium fees included, cremation at our arranged time, and return of ashes in a simple container.

process.title: The Direct Cremation Process
process.subtitle: Simple, straightforward arrangements with minimal stress

steps.title: Contact Us
steps.description: Call us 24/7 on 0161 969 2288. We'll take some initial details and arrange to bring your loved one into our care. This can be from home, hospital, or care home anywhere in Greater Manchester.

steps.title: Simple Arrangements
steps.description: We'll arrange a brief meeting or phone call to complete the necessary paperwork. This includes the cremation application and any required certificates. We handle all the administration for you.

steps.title: Care & Preparation
steps.description: Your loved one rests in our chapel of rest. You can visit if you wish, though this is entirely optional. We ensure they are cared for with dignity and respect throughout their time with us.

steps.title: The Cremation
steps.description: The cremation takes place at a local crematorium at a time we arrange. This is unattended - there is no service or ceremony. The process is carried out with the same dignity as any funeral.

steps.title: Return of Ashes
steps.description: Ashes are usually ready within 2-3 working days. We'll contact you to arrange collection from our Sale office, or we can scatter them in the crematorium's garden of remembrance if preferred.

memorial.title: Creating Your Own Memorial
memorial.subtitle: Celebrate in Your Own Way
memorial.intro: Direct cremation doesn't mean you can't celebrate your loved one's life. Many families find comfort in arranging their own memorial when the time feels right.
ideas: A gathering at home with family and friends sharing memories
A memorial service at a place that was special to your loved one
Scattering ashes at a meaningful location
Planting a memorial tree or creating a garden
Organising a celebration of life event
Creating an online memorial or memory book
memorial.conclusion: We can provide advice on memorial options and help with any arrangements you'd like to make.

items.question: What exactly is TEST direct cremation?
items.answer: Direct cremation is a simple cremation without a funeral service or ceremony. Your loved one is cremated privately at a time arranged by us, without mourners present. It's sometimes called an unattended cremation or simple cremation. The ashes are then returned to you, allowing you to arrange any memorial in your own time and way.

items.question: Can we visit before the cremation?
items.answer: Yes, you're welcome to visit your loved one in our chapel of rest if you wish, though this is entirely optional. Some families find it helpful to say a private goodbye, while others prefer not to visit. There's no right or wrong choice - we'll support whatever feels right for you. TEST

items.question: How much does direct cremation cost?
items.answer: Our direct cremation service starts from £995, which includes everything: our professional services, collection from anywhere in Greater Manchester, care of your loved one, a simple coffin, the crematorium fee, and return of the ashes. There are no hidden charges.

items.question: How long does the process take?
items.answer: From the time we bring your loved one into our care, the cremation typically takes place within 7-14 days, depending on paperwork and crematorium availability. Ashes are usually ready for collection 2-3 working days after the cremation.

items.question: Is direct cremation right for us?
items.answer: Direct cremation suits many different situations. It's ideal if your loved one requested simplicity, if you prefer to celebrate their life in your own way, if family are scattered and need time to gather, or if you want to avoid financial pressure. We're happy to discuss whether it's the right choice for your circumstances.
